ids_info.name: pf_plasma
ids_info.description: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements

pf_plasma/element.documentation: Set of plasma elements. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements.

pf_plasma/element/geometry.documentation: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/geometry_type.documentation: Type used to describe the element shape (1:'outline', 2:'rectangle', 3:'oblique', 4:'arcs of circle, 5: 'annulus', 6 : 'thick line'). Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the element. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element.

Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the element. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/oblique/r.documentation: Major radius of the reference point (from which the alpha and beta angles are defined, marked by a + on the diagram). Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/oblique/lengt.documentation: Length of the parallelogram side inclined with angle alpha with respect to the major radius axis. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

Length of the parallelogram side inclined with angle beta with respect to the height axis. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/oblique/alpha.documentation: Inclination of first angle measured counter-clockwise from horizontal outwardly directed radial vector (grad R). Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/oblique/beta.documentation: Inclination of second angle measured counter-clockwise from vertically upwards directed vector (grad Z). If both alpha and beta are zero (rectangle) then the simpler rectangular elements description should be used. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

pf_plasma/element/geometry/arcs_of_circl.documentation: Description of the element contour by a set of arcs of circle. For each of these, the position of the start point is given together with the curvature radius. The end point is given by the start point of the next arc of circle. Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements. Within element container: Set of plasma elements. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element.

Major radii of the start point of each arc of circle. The end point is given by the start point of the next arc of circle.

Within pf_plasma IDS: Description of the axisymmetric currents flowing in the plasma, to be used in circuit equations, represented by a set of elements.
